intro: Solanum ptychanthum, commonly known as the purple mulch tomato, is a species native to South America. It is a shrub-like plant that typically grows in dry, arid environments. The plant produces small, purple fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are usually white or pale purple. Solanum ptychanthum belongs to the nightshade family, which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and peppers.
